webLinks.linkText: Le Jolly Market

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip on public transport.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Le Jolly Market from Thursday 11 to Sunday 21 December. Weekdays between 4pm and 10.30pm and weekends between 11am and 10.30pm (hours vary).

The Christmas markets are being held at Customs House Forecourt (on Alfred St).

Traffic will be heavy in the area throughout the event. Motorists are advised to allow additional travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity.

Special event clearways will be in place to facilitate Sydney Trains trackwork replacement bus operations

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.
properties.displayName: SPECIAL EVENT CLEARWAYS Sydney Trains Trackwork

webLinks.linkText: Surry Hills Christmas Fair

properties.publicTransport: Route 304 and 352 buses will be diverting while roads are closed. Check bus service alerts and plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and special event clearways will be in place for City of Sydney's Surry Hills Christmas Fair event along Crown Street on Saturday 13 December. The event runs from 2:30pm until 10pm.

  • Crown St will be closed in both directions between Cleveland St and Foveaux St from 7am until 11:30pm
  • Sections of Arthur St, Collins St, Collins Ln, Davies St, Devonshire St, Jesson Ln, Jesson St, High Holborn St, Landsowne St, Miles St, Rainford St, Richards Ln and Withers Ln will also be closed.
  • Motorists travelling from the south towards the city should detour via Cleveland St, Elizabeth St and Albion St.
  • Motorists travelling from the north should detour via Foveaux St, Elizabeth St and Cleveland St.

Allow extra travel time, follow the directions of traffic control and be aware of increased pedestrian activity

Special event clearways will be in effect from 7am until 11:30pm on sections of Crown St, Arthur St, Collins St, Davies St, Landsdowne St, Rainford St and Withers Ln.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

webLinks.linkText: What's on at ICC Sydney Theatre

properties.publicTransport: L1 light rail services run regularly to stops at Darling Harbour. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Events at ICC Sydney Theatre:

  • Oprah Winfrey - Thursday 4 December
  • Jimmy Yang - Friday 5 December
  • Kelsea Ballerini - Saturday 6 + Sunday 7 December
  • Jacob Collier - Thursday 11 December
  • Patrizio Buanne - Thursday 11 December
  • The Wiggles Tree of Wisdom Big Show - Saturday 20 December

﻿Allow extra travel time on roads in the city and Pyrmont around Darling Harbour as traffic may be heavier than usual as attendees travel to the shows, particularly during peak evening periods.

Motorists should exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Lewis Capaldi at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday 6, Sunday 7 and Tuesday 9 December. Shows start nightly at 7pm and finish at 10:30pm

Traffic will be heavy approaching Olympic Park on concert nights, particularly during weeknight peak travel times and while other events are on in the precinct. Motorists should allow extra travel time on the M4, Parramatta Rd, Homebush Bay Drive, Silverwater Rd, Centenary Dr and Concord Rd. 

If you need to drive it is essential that you pre-book parking online, an event flat rate $35 parking fee will apply.

To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to accommodate increased public transport services and ensure pedestrian safety during the event. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park interactive map.

roads.mainStreet: M4 Motorway, Homebush Bay Drive, Parramatta Road

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Central Coast Mariners v Auckland FC at polytec Stadium. Kick-off at 7.35pm, full time at 9.35pm

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to and from the stadium. Allow extra travel time and use local parking. 

Dane Drive will be closed before the match from 6.15pm between the Central Coast Highway and Donnison Street and will reopen once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
NBL Illawarra Hawks v Brisbane Bullets at WIN Entertainment Centre. Tip-off at 7.30pm, full time around 9.30pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the Wollongong CBD and on local roads around WIN Entertainment Centre as fans travel to the match in the already busy evening peak.

Local roads around the stadium may close before, during and after the game for the safety of pedestrians.

Fans driving to the game on the freeway are encouraged to use the Masters Rd exit to avoid congestion at Mount Ousley Rd, both in and out of Wollongong.

Motorists should allow extra time for parking and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Ingham Day at Royal Randwick Racecourse. Gates open 11.15am, start 12:20pm and finish 5.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on Anzac Pde, Doncaster Ave, High St, Alison Rd and Darley Rd as crowds travel to the event.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

roads.mainStreet: Anzac Parade, Alison Road, High Street

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Sara Landry at Sydney Showground on Friday from 6pm until 11pm.

The precinct will be very busy with 70,000 Lady Gaga fans travelling to Accor Stadium at the same time.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd as concert-goers make their way to Olympic Park is the already busy evening peak on Friday.

Pre-book parking online ahead of time to secure a space, parking is in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry. To get to your carpark and avoid the heavy traffic congestion expected at the Homebush Bay Drive roundabout, use Silverwater Road, Holker Street and Hill Road

Sydney Olympic Park Authority may close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the show. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

properties.otherAdvice:
EPIK Festival at Sydney Showground on Saturday from 4pm until midnight.

The precinct will be very busy with 70,000 Lady Gaga fans travelling to Accor Stadium at the same time.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.

  • PARKING: Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space, parking is in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time as traffic will be heavy with other events happening in the precinct.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park. Travel on trains is included.
  • Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct and traffic congestion is expected before and after the show. For road closure details, visit the Sydney Olympic Park Authority interactive map.

properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League Men: Western Sydney Wanderers v Brisbane Roar at CommBank Stadium. Kick-off at 5pm, finish around 6.55pm.

Traffic will be heavier than usual on roads approaching the stadium as fans travel to the match. Allow extra travel time on roads including Parramatta Road, Church Street, Victoria Road, James Ruse Drive and Pennant Hills Road. 

Motorists should also exercise caution as pedestrian activity will be high on roads between Parramatta Interchange and the stadium. 

Be patient leaving car parks as traffic will be heavy and follow the directions of traffic controllers and Police.

properties.publicTransport: Travel on transport is included in concert tickets, additional light rail services will run frequently before and after the show. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Dom Dolla at Allianz Stadium. Show starts at 5.30pm, finishes around 11pm.

With up to 40,000 fans expected, ticketholders are urged to leave the car at home and catch public transport to avoid heavy traffic and the high demand for parking.

Traffic delays are expected on roads in and around Moore Park as attendees make their way to and from the concert.

Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow of extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

Changed traffic conditions

  • Driver Ave will be partially closed outside the stadium from 3pm and will reopen once crowds have safely left the area.
  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 and EP3 grass car parks and drop-off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd.
  • Drop-off locations: Errol Flynn Boulevard, Driver Avenue or Moore Park Road at Oatley Road opposite the Stadium. 
  • Pick-up locations: Errol Flynn Boulevard or Moore Park Road at Oatley Road opposite the Stadium.
  • To avoid traffic delays, consider parking or get dropped off further away and walking to the Stadium.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion St, Fitzroy St, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd, and from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland St.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

Significant traffic delays are expected each night as concert-goers make their way to Moore Park in the already busy evening peak.

Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on the Eastern Distributor, Moore Park Rd, Cleveland St, Anzac Pde and Lang Rd.

  • No through-traffic will be available on Driver Ave, however access to EP2 and EP3 grass car parks and drop-off areas will be maintained from Moore Park Rd and Lang Rd.
  • Drop-off locations: Errol Flynn Boulevard, Driver Avenue or Moore Park Road at Oatley Road opposite the Stadium. 
  • Pick-up locations: Errol Flynn Boulevard or Moore Park Road at Oatley Road opposite the Stadium.
  • To avoid traffic delays, consider parking or get dropped off further away and walking to the Stadium.

Special event clearways will be in place on roads in Moore Park and surrounding areas from 3pm to midnight on sections of Albion St, Lang Rd and Moore Park Rd, and from 6am to midnight on sections of Cleveland St and Fitzroy St.  

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.publicTransport: Route 313, 370, 373 and 374 buses will be diverting and using different stops. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access will be place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve at Coogee Beach for the Coogee Sparkles event.

Road closures from 5.30pm to 10.30pm:

  • Alfreda St between Brook St and Arden St
  • Arden St between Carr St and Bream St
  • Brook St between Dolphin St and Coogee Bay Rd
  • Coogee Bay Rd between Brook St and Arden St
  • Dolphin St from Brook St to Arden St/end of the road at Coogee Pavilion
  • Sections of Baden St, Beach St, Brook St, Hill St, Ormond Gdn and Vicar St will also close.
  • Carparks at Coogee beach off Dolphin St will also close from 12pm midday until 10.30pm.

Special event clearways will be in effect from 4pm to 10:30pm on Alfreda St, Arden St, Beach St, Bream St, Brook St, Dolphin St and Coogee Bay Rd. Clearways will be in effect on a section of Brook St from 12pm midday to 10.30pm NYE.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

NYE 2025 TfNSW Interactive Road Closure and Clearway map

properties.publicTransport: Buses will be diverting and using different stops. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures and restricted access arrangements will be in place as large crowds celebrate New Year's Eve in Rose Bay and Vaucluse.

From 3pm until 2am the following roads will close. Access for local residents will be maintained by traffic controllers until 6pm only, not access after 6pm unti roads reopen.

  • Rose Bay: roads into Rose Bay from New South Head Rd including Bayview Hill Rd, Caledonian Rd, Collins Ave, Dumaresq Rd and Tivoli Ave. 
  • Vaucluse: roads into Vaucluse from New South Head Rd including Carrara Rd, Hopetoun Ave, Old South Head Rd, Petrarch Ave, Queens Ave, Serpentine Pde. Vaucluse Rd will be closed southbound and remain open for one-way northbound traffic only.

Roads will reopen from 2am or once crowds have cleared however motorists should expect heavy traffic leaving the area after the midnight fireworks and should travel later to avoid the peak traffic.

Motorists are reminded that access into various Eastern Suburb peninsulas will be restricted to local residents only from 3pm, in some areas access is restricted to all vehicle traffic including residents after such time.

Special event clearways will be in effect on sections of New South Head Rd in Vaucluse from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
With major road closures and parking restrictions in place this New Year's Eve attendees should leave the car at home and catch public transport instead.

Roads along the waterfront in Milsons Point, Lavender Bay and Blues Point start closing the night before on Tuesday 30 December.

On New Year's Eve roads key roads in North Sydney CBD close from 3pm follow by major closures in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and Lavender Bay from 5pm. Roads will reopen by 3am on 1 January.

Key road closure timings:

  • 7pm 30 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: harbourfront roads around vantage points in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point will close including Blues Point Rd, Lavender Cres, Kirribilli Ave, Olympic Dr, Broughton St, Pitt St, Railway Ave and Henry Lawson Ave.
  • 8am 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: sections of Blues Point Rd from French St, Alfred St Sth and local roads surrounding vantage points will close. 
  • 12pm 31 Dec - 3am 1 Jan: Fitzroy St between Alfred St South and Broughton St. Use High St instead.
  • 3pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: Blue St at North Sydney Station and Ennis Rd from Broughton St at Milsons Point Station will close.
  • 5pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: more major roads in North Sydney, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and Waverton including sections of Miller St, Blues Point Rd, Lavender St, Union St, Balls Head Rd, Pacific Hwy southbound, Alfred St South, Walker St, Denison St and surrounding local roads. 
  • From 5pm access to Kirribilli and Milsons Point is via Military Rd only due to the closure of Pacific Hwy southbound.
  • 8pm 31 Dec – 3am 1 Jan: the Pacific Hwy northbound off ramp to North Sydney from Sydney Harbour Bridge. Use the Miller St or Military Rd off-ramps instead for access to North Sydney.
  • 11pm – 1.30am: Sydney Harbour Bridge closed in both directions and Western Distributor fully closed between Pyrmont and the city. Arthur St southbound between Berry St and Mount St, all traffic to turn left on to Warringah Fwy northbound.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Kirribilli, Lavender Bay, McMahons Point, Milsons Point and North Sydney between 1pm NYE and 3am NYD. On some streets clearways in Milsons Point, Kirribilli and McMahons Point will be in effect from 6pm 30 Dec.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Tens of thousands of people are expected to ring in the New Year at the NYE event in Parramatta Park from 5pm to 9.30pm. Fireworks at 9pm. Entry is free and no tickets are required.

Motorists should expect delays throughout Parramatta CBD and surrounding the park, motorists should also exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.

Road closures:

  • Parramatta Park will be closed to all vehicles from 6am on Wednesday 31 December. There will be no parking inside the Park and a number external parking spaces around the Park will not be available due to event operations.
  • Westmead: Roads close from 4pm to 10pm including parts of Queens Rd, Park Ave, Alfred St, Central Ave and Railway Parade. 
  • Parramatta: Roads close from 8.30pm to 10pm including O'Connell St, George St, Hunter St, Macquarie St, Pitt St and Park Pde.
  • The Parramatta River cycle way between O’Connell Street Bridge and the Parramatta Park weir will be closed from 6am on event day.

webLinks.linkText: City of Sydney - New Year's Eve 2025
NYE 2025 TfNSW Interactive Road Closure and Clearway map

properties.publicTransport: Transport services will be significantly affected by road closures in the city. Visit transportnsw.info/sydney-nye for all the details you need to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Significant road closures and widespread parking restrictions will be in effect across the Sydney CBD and Pyrmont as hundreds of thousands of people gather at harbour vantage points for the New Year's Eve 9pm and midnight fireworks.

Do not drive on NYE - parking is limited and access to properties and car parks will be restricted. Catch public transport.

KEY ROAD CLOSURES:

  • The Cahill Expressway southbound lanes 7 and 8 on the Harbour Bridge and Circular Quay Overpass will close from 4am on NYE. The Cahill Walk will also close.
  • Roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks close from 12pm and 2pm
  • Major closures in the city centre and Pyrmont from 5pm and 7pm.
  • The Harbour Bridge walkway and cycleway close from 6pm to 2am. CBD cycleways across the city will close when roads close.
  • By 11pm the city is locked down with no vehicle access, only through traffic available via the Cross City Tunnel and Harbour Tunnel
  • The Sydney Harbour Bridge will be closed in both directions from 11pm until 1.30am. The citybound lanes of the Anzac Bridge, Western Distributor, M4 / M8 citybound tunnels and Iron Cove Link will also be closed from 11pm to 1.30am.
  • Roads start reopening from 1.30am on NYD including the Harbour Bridge, with most roads reopened by 4am.
  • See the interactive map for full details of all the road closure locations and times.

Special event clearway parking restrictions will be in effect on most roads in the city and Pyrmont from 6am NYE until 4am NYD. Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in signposted clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.

properties.otherAdvice:
Road closures, clearways and restricted access arrangements will be in place this New Year's Eve in Balmain, Rozelle, Birchgrove and Drummoyne in the Balmain Peninsula.

  • From 3pm to 1am road closures will be in place on sections of Darling St, Ballast Point Rd, Booth St, Brent St, Evan St, Grove St, Joseph St, Hartley St, Hanover St, Loughlin St, Mackenzie St, Mansfield St, McKell St, Mullens St, Rose St, Terry St, The Crescent, Waragal Ave, Wharf Rd and Yeend St.
  • There will be no access for general traffic from Victoria Rd into the Balmain Peninsula after 3pm.
  • Access will be permitted for Balmain Access Permit holders only, buses, taxis and other authorised vehicles. NSW Police will be onsite vetting vehicles at closure locations.
  • From 3pm until 7pm, Taxis and rideshare vehicles will be permitted through closures with proof of residence pick up / drop off. From 7pm until 1am, all taxis and rideshare vehicles will not be permitted through closure points.
  • Roads will reopen from 1am on New Year's Day or at the direction of NSW Police when safe to do so. Heavy traffic is expected exiting the area after the midnight fireworks so be patient or delay your travel until after 1am.

Special event clearways will be in effect on Victoria Rd from The Crescent, Rozelle to Westbourne St, Drummoyne (western side) from 3pm NYE until 2am NYD. From 3pm extended no-parking and bus zones will be in effect on sections of Darling St, Eaton St, Grove St and the Crescent, and no-stopping zones will be in effect on sections of Montague St.

Clearways are strict no parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and businesses with parking permits or TfNSW Mobility Scheme permit holders. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.﻿

properties.otherAdvice: The Wiggles are presenting 2 shows at Newcastle Entertainment Centre (10am and 1pm). The right hand turn from Griffiths Road into the centre will be restricted. Traffic will be heavy in the area before and after the concerts. Motorists should be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area and follow the direction of traffic crews.

properties.publicTransport: Ferry services will be impacted while events on the Harbour take place. A Sydney Harbour Exclusion Zone will be in effect from 12pm to 2.20pm and F1 Manly, Manly Fast Ferry, F7 Double Bay and F9 Watsons Bay services will be suspended for periods of time. Catch buses or use other transport modes during this time, additional route buses will run to supplement some ferry services. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
The Sydney Hobart Yacht Race is taking place on Sydney Harbour on Boxing Day, from 1pm to 3pm.

Traffic may be heavier than usual at popular vantage points to watch the race, including around Manly, Mosman, Vaucluse and Watsons Bay.

Allow extra travel time if you are driving through these areas.

properties.publicTransport: Concert tickets include travel on public transport. Express trains and Major Event Buses will run. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Lady Gaga concerts at Accor Stadium on Friday 12 and Saturday 13 December. Gates open from 5pm, concert starts at 7.30pm each night.

The Wiggles shows at Qudos Bank Arena on Saturday 13 December. Shows between 10am and 3pm, finishing at 4.10pm approx.

  • With around 70,000 Lady Gaga fans expected each night along with thousands of Wiggles attendees on Saturday, significant traffic delays are expected on roads approaching the precinct.
  • Motorists should allow plenty of extra travel time on roads approaching Olympic Park including the M4 Mwy, Homebush Bay Dr, Concord Rd, Lane Cove Rd, Parramatta Rd, Centenary Dr and Silverwater Rd.
  • PARKING: Do not drive unless you have pre-booked parking. Pre-book online ahead of time to secure a space as parking will be in high demand. A flat rate $35 parking fee applies. 
  • If you have pre-booked your parking, follow the directions of staff and have your parking ticket ready to show at the car park entry.
  • Carpool with your group and allow plenty of extra travel time. Significant traffic delays are expected, especially on Friday during the busy evening peak.
  • Alternatively, consider parking at a nearby train station commuter car park and continuing your trip by train to Olympic Park, at no extra cost.

Sydney Olympic Park Authority will close local roads in the precinct to ensure pedestrian safety during the event and to accommodate additional transport services. For road closure details, view the interactive map.

webLinks.linkText: Australia Day 2026

properties.publicTransport: Ferries will be affected during the day and night due to exclusion zones on the harbour. Buses will also be diverting and using different stops due to road closures. Light rail will not run between Circular Quay and Town Hall from 7.30pm to 10.30pm. Visit transportnsw.info for details.
properties.otherAdvice:
Roads around Circular Quay and The Rocks, and in Milsons Point will close during the day and evening for Australia Day events in the city and around the harbour.

Key road closure timings:

  • 4am to midnight: Around The Rocks on George St from Essex St to Hickson Rd, and sections of OPT Elevated Rd from Hickson Rd, Circular Quay West, Argyle St, Essex St and Pitt St.
  • 7am to 10am: Around Barangaroo and Millers Point on Hickson Rd from Napoleon St to Pottinger St, Towns Pl from Dalgety Rd to Hickson Rd and Barton St (for Oz Day 10K wheelchair race).
  • 7am to midnight: Around Dawes Point on Hickson Rd from George St to Pottinger St.
  • 7:30pm to 10:30pm: Around Sydney CBD including Cahill Expressway lanes 7 & 8 and Overpass at Circular Quay including the High St, Mount St and Domain Tunnel on-ramps and lane 4 on the Harbour Bridge. Roads in Circular Quay north of Bridge St including sections of Albert St, Alfred St, Circular Quay East, Conservatorium Rd, Dalley St, Essex St, George St, Loftus St, Pitt St, Philip St, Macquarie St, Reiby Place, Underwood St and Young St. 
  • 9:15pm to 10:15pm: Sections of Grosvenor St/Bridge St between Lang Street and Pitt Street  
  • 10:30am to 1pm: Around Milsons Point/Kirribilli on Olympic Drive between Broughton St and Alfred St South

*The speed limit on the Harbour Bridge will be reduced to 40km/h from 7:30pm to 10.30pm.

The Cahill Expressway Circular Quay overpass walkway will be closed from 5pm to 9:30pm. The Sydney Harbour Bridge Walkway and Cycleway will remain open.

**No heavy vehicle access to Hickson Rd north of Pottinger St between 4am and 7am due to the closure of George St south of Hickson Rd and lack of turnaround area.

Special event clearways will be in effect on various roads in Circular Quay and The Rocks between 3am and midnight and throughout the CBD from 5pm until 10.30pm.

Clearways are strict no-parking zones for all vehicle types, and apply even to local residents and TfNSW Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your vehicle is towed, you can search your vehicle registration at the Find My Car website to find its new location, or alternatively call 132 701 to speak to an operator.ar

webLinks.linkText: Christmas Carols in Parramatta Park

properties.publicTransport: Trains and buses run regularly to Parramatta within walking distance of the park. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Christmas Carols in Parramatta Park from 3pm to 9.30pm. Entry is free and no tickets are required.

With thousands of people expected to attend, motorists should allow extra travel time on roads approaching and throughout Parramatta CBD.

Exercise caution and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on roads in the area.
